Probably one of the most defining games in shooter history, Half Life still delivers amazing gameplay, story and atmosphere after 18 years. If you're unsure whether this game can hold up to todays standards, the only lacking thing you'll find are the outdated graphics (although there are HD models available in the game), the gameplay still feels fresh and unique to this day. Truly a timeless classic.
A true masterpiece of its time and is still a treat to play today.

An absolute classic FPS with a lasting impact games.  Half-Life introduced storytelling ideas that games still use today, and couples that with very solid shooting mechanics and great level design.  With new graphics and a better physics system for pushing boxes, it could easily pass for a great modern game.  You should play through it if for no other reason than to experience history.
This game is old as shit... but still fun to play.

The life of a scientist is rough.  First you achieve the simplest theoretical science degree you can from MIT.  Then you get a low level position at a prestigeous yet highly secure, government hyper-funded, mult-mile spread science facility.  Following that, you earn a reputation making friends with superiors and security guards, and unlocking offices by sneaking in through oddly wide air vents.  Next you have do do the real work.

Wild nights of parties and birthday cakes.

Then you have the whole science thing, but that comes simple.

But the most important thing that you will ever do in the entirety of the universe lies just inside these doors.  There is a helpless... lone... coworker... who needs.... his lunch exploded.

Then there's the whole shooting alien invaders that are confused and crazed as ****, but that's just a normal Tuesday.

Obra maestra.

What can I say to add to the conversation around this game? It's an undisputed classic, and believe me when I say that that basically never happens. But [i]Half Life[/i] brooks no argument -- whether because it's a turning point for gaming design, or simply because of the massive nostalgia trip it generates, the original [i]Half Life[/i] has become shorthand for "one of those games that changes how we think about gaming"

And for that reason alone it's worth a look... but you should also play it because it's bloody fun.
Nice.

Released in 1998 and still offers gameplay that you won't get bored off. You can spice up the game by playing it cooperatively or with custom mods through a mod called Sven coop. Sven coop also allows you to play the coop story from the PS2 version called Half-life Decay.
This game should obviously get everyone's Test of Time award.

A game that started it for many in the early days of Steam, and even before..
An inspirational FPS classic that deserves to be known for it's contributions to gaming as we know today and things we may or may not have experienced before. 
Half-Life is truely a groundbreaking and a fluent felt game that even birthed many Mods such as The Specialists, Natural Selection, Vampire Slayer, Earth's Special Forces, BrainBread, FireArms, Science and Industry, and many more that could all be located in Third-Party mod's section back in the early '00's on Steam.
 It's engine GoldSrc also created some great standalone games! 
Some we know today as Counter-Strike, Day of Defeat Team Fortress Classic, Sven-Coop, and even Richochet were all located on Steams front page at one time.
Of course we have stuff like Quake to also thank for this amazing evolution in gaming but if it had not been for Half-Life who knows what gaming as we know today would be. 
Yes I really do think this was that inspirational as a whole to 3D gaming in general.
So if you havn't already (you're missing out!) I would definitely give Half-Life a try if you are into Science Fiction themed FPS! 

http://store.steampowered.com/app/70/HalfLife/

Also, If you want to learn how to download mods you will need Half-Life in your steam games and you can download modded games from http://www.moddb.com/
Okay so here is a brief tutorial on how to download and play the mods in Steam

1. Download the Half-Life mod you desire from Moddb.
For example http://www.moddb.com/mods/brainbread 
2. Put that in your  C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common\half-life\  folder
3. Restart steam.
4. Find the Game in your Steam Library and enjoy!
